fields.headline: Hawk-Eye to be given debut at Maine Road
fields.bodyText: August 11: Tonight's Manchester City - Watford game, quite apart from being a new experience for the debutant managers, will also give armchair fans the chance to witness Hawk-Eye technology being used at a football match for the first time. The system, introduced to cricket by Channel 4 last May, is still in development but ITV Sport will use it at up to 80 of its live Nationwide games, the intention being to provide 3-D verdicts of contentious issues. ITV Sport tested the system in match conditions for the first time at last week's Wolves v Liverpool friendly and intend to use it for Worthington Cup and Champions League games. It involves six cameras - one behind each goal and two in each half - and uses technology similar to that used for tracking missiles and guiding brain surgeons' scalpels.
